main event: On January 13, 1950, a sighting of an unusual aerial phenomenon was reported at Holloman Air Force Base in New Mexico.
interesting points: The object was observed for 5 minutes on January 12 at 1900 hours and again at 2100 hours., The object changed color from brilliant white to green and red., It hovered approximately 10° to 15° above the horizon., The sighting involved only one object, which was starlike in appearance and did not resemble known celestial bodies., The observer was a reliable file clerk at the Air Provost Marshal's Office.
sighted object: an unusual aerial phenomenon described as starlike with changing colors
location: Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico, US
witness description: File clerk in the Air Provost Marshal's Office, Holloman AFB, reliable observer.
